result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martel D Scott

defendant.name: Scott, Martel D
defendant.address: 4740 West Donges Lane, Brown Deer, WI 53223

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Martel D Scott appeared by video.  Attorney Michael M. Hayes appeared by video for Martel D Scott.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.
Initial appearance done on defendant's new case (22CT754) which is adjourned for pretrial conference. This case to follow.
Case remains calendared in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Martel D Scott in court.  Attorney Michael M. Hayes in court for Martel D Scott.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Parties inform the court of a new case that is set for an initial appearance on 10/6/22. Court will address discovery and offer at the next hearing. Case to be scheduled after the initial appearance on the new case. Amended complaint has been filed. Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Martel D Scott in court via phone with attorney Michael M. Hayes in person.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense informs the court the case may resolve through a deferred prosecution agreement. Discussion held.
Defendant's other open cases to be transferred to Br. 30.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Martel D Scott in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Martel D Scott appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and awaiting an offer and requests an adjournment. Court orders matter adjourned. 
Case remains calendared in branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Martel D Scott in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Defense's Motion to withdraw warrant

Adjustment Number: 22A 037838,
Payable Number: 1000267,
Receipt Number: 22RP015536,
Amount: $20.00
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Martel D Scott not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/28/22 @ 2p
